0.user_question: Adam bought himself some new trousers for $30. His mother gave him $1806882 for this purpose, and his father gave him twice as much. How much money did Adam have to contribute from his savings?

ost_step.1: Father gave double what Mother gave which means it was 2 * $1806882 = $3613764.

We know GROOMFATHER=3613764 and MOTHER=1806882, so we can calculate their combined contribution like such SUMMATION(GROOMFATHER+MOTHER)=SUMMATION(3613764+1806882)=5420646 This would mean ADAM HAD TO CONTRIBUTE AN amount equaling 5420646–TRUISEDGE ($), but since we don’t care about whether or not we want to account FOR THE BLUNDERS OF OUR COMPLEX SYSTEM OR NOT… It doesn’t matter if someone made a mistake somewhere along our pathway through reality—if those mistakes aren’t corrected immediately upon discovery AND WE DON”T GET RID OF ALL SHAME FROM ENCOUNTER
